getInRange

public java.util.List<org.bukkit.entity.Player> getInRange(org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity theEntity,
                                                           int theRange)
Gets players in range of a bukkit Entity.

Parameters:
theEntity - the bukkit Entity to check for players around.
theRange - the Range, in blocks, to check around theEntity.
Returns:
returns a list of Players around theEntity.

getInRange

public java.util.List<org.bukkit.entity.Player> getInRange(org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity theEntity,
                                                           int theRange,
                                                           org.bukkit.entity.Player excludePlayer)
Gets players in range of a bukkit Entity, excluding a specified Player.

Parameters:
theEntity - the bukkit Entity to check for players around.
theRange - the Range, in blocks, to check around theEntity.
excludePlayer - the bukkit Player to exclude from the returned list.
Returns:
returns a list of Players around theEntity, excluding the excludePlayer.

getInventoryMap

public java.util.Map<org.bukkit.Material,java.lang.Integer> getInventoryMap(org.bukkit.entity.Player thePlayer)
Gets a Map of a player's inventory with a bukkit Material and Integer amount for each item. Unlike bukkit's build in getInventory, this will add up the total number of each Material.

Parameters:
thePlayer - the Player whose inventory is being checked.
Returns:
returns a Map.

getInventoryIdMap

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getInventoryIdMap(org.bukkit.entity.Player thePlayer)
Alternate usage that gets a Map of a player's inventory with a String representation of itemID:data and Integer amount for each item. Unlike bukkit's build in getInventory, this will add up the total number of each itemID.

Parameters:
thePlayer - the Player whose inventory is being checked.
Returns:
returns a Map.

thePlayer - the Bukkit Player object that is doing the talking.

checkLevel

public boolean checkLevel(org.bukkit.entity.Player thePlayer,
                          java.lang.String theLevel,
                          java.lang.String highLevel,
                          boolean negativeRequirement)
Checks the player's level.

Parameters:
thePlayer - The bukkit Player object of the player being checked.
theLevel - the String value of the level being checked against.
highLevel - String value of the high level being checked against, if specifying a low and high number. Can also be set to null.
negativeRequirement - set to true if this is a negative (-) requirement.
Returns:
Whether the conditions were met or failed.

checkSaturation

public boolean checkSaturation(org.bukkit.entity.Player thePlayer,
                               java.lang.String saturationType,
                               boolean negativeRequirement)
Checks the players saturation levels.

Parameters:
thePlayer - The Player being checked.
saturationType - String value of the saturation type being checked against. Valid types: FULL, HUNGRY, STARVING
negativeRequirement - Set to true if this is a negative (-) requirement.
Returns:
Whether the conditions were met or failed.

public boolean checkName(org.bukkit.entity.Player thePlayer,
                         java.util.List<java.lang.String> theNames,
                         boolean negativeRequirement)
Checks the name of thePlayer against a supplied List of player names.

Parameters:
thePlayer - the Player to compare to.
theNames - the List of names to check against.
negativeRequirement - Set to true if this is a negative (-) requirement.
Returns:
Whether the conditions were met or failed.

checkFunds

public boolean checkFunds(org.bukkit.entity.Player thePlayer,
                          java.lang.String theFunds,
                          boolean negativeRequirement)
Checks the funds of the player against a given value with Vault.

Parameters:
thePlayer - the Player to check funds of.
theFunds - the String representation of the Integer of funds to check for.
negativeRequirement - Set to true if this is a negative (-) requirement.
Returns:
Whether the conditions were met or failed.

checkInventory

public boolean checkInventory(org.bukkit.entity.Player thePlayer,
                              java.lang.String theItem,
                              java.lang.String theData,
                              java.lang.String theAmount,
                              boolean negativeRequirement)
Checks the Inventory of the player against a given value.

Parameters:
thePlayer - the Player whose inventory shall be checked.
theItem - the String representation of the item to check for. Can use a bukkit Material, such as IRON_ORE, or can use typeID format, such as 44.
theData - the String representation of the Data value of the item being checked. Only used when dealing with a typeID format of theItem, otherwise can be null.
theAmount - the String representation of the Integer amount of the item to check for. If null, 1 is assumed.
negativeRequirement - Set to true if this is a negative (-) requirement.
Returns:
Whether the conditions were met or failed.

checkHand

public boolean checkHand(org.bukkit.entity.Player thePlayer,
                         java.lang.String theItem,
                         java.lang.String theData,
                         java.lang.String theAmount,
                         boolean negativeRequirement)
Checks the item in hand of the player against a given value.

Parameters:
thePlayer - the Player whose inventory shall be checked.
theItem - the String representation of the item to check for. Can use a bukkit Material, such as IRON_ORE, or can use typeID format, such as 44.
theData - the String representation of the Data value of the item being checked. Only used when dealing with a typeID format of theItem, otherwise can be null.
theAmount - the String representation of the Integer amount of the item to check for. If null, 1 is assumed.
negativeRequirement - Set to true if this is a negative (-) requirement.
Returns:
Whether the conditions were met or failed.
